Pre-Game Insights: India aims to secure their second win in the Super 8 challenge against Bangladesh on Saturday (June 22).
India is riding high on a 47-run victory over AFG.
The team is now eyeing a fifth consecutive win in T20 World Cup meetings against BAN.
Bangladesh enters the fray after a 28-run loss by DLS method to Australia.
India has a strong head-to-head record (12/1) against Bangladesh.
Bangladesh finished second in the group stage and now sits rock-bottom on the Group 1 table.
The match will be held at the Sir Vivian Richards Stadium, North Sound, Antigua.
The match is scheduled for Saturday, June 22, 2024, at 8 pm IST.
Miscellaneous Highlights: A testing batting track is expected for the match.
Rohit Sharma is set to surpass the 500-run mark in T20Is against Bangladesh.
Jasprit Bumrah is expected to weave his magic again.
The Indian batting needs to combat the threat of Mustafizur Rahmanâ€™s bowling variations.
The match is considered a Super Saturday for Indian cricket fans.
